SEARCH
Package com.example.lottary.ui.browse

Class BrowseListFragment

java.lang.Object
androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
com.example.lottary.ui.browse.BrowseListFragment
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.activity.result.ActivityResultCaller, androidx.lifecycle.HasDefaultViewModelProviderFactory, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner, BrowseEventsAdapter.Listener
public class BrowseListFragment extends androidx.fragment.app.Fragment implements BrowseEventsAdapter.Listener
BrowseListFragment Role / Purpose: - Displays a scrollable list of events for the Browse tab using a RecyclerView. - Subscribes to Firestore for "recently created" events and keeps an in-memory list all. - Applies keyword and structured filters (open only / geolocation / date range / types) on the UI thread. - Forwards item interactions (open details / join waitlist) to the appropriate destinations. Lifecycle: - Firestore listener is registered in onViewCreated(View, Bundle) and removed in onDestroyView(). - Adapter is bound/unbound together with the fragment's view lifecycle (not the activity lifecycle). Threading: - All list mutations and adapter submissions occur on the main thread. - Firestore callbacks are delivered on the main thread by default in Android.

    • matchesTypes

      private boolean matchesTypes(@NonNull Event e, @NonNull Set<String> selected)
      Returns true if the event matches any of the selected types. Strategy: 1) If no type is selected, it's a match. 2) If event has a concrete type, compare case-insensitively. 3) Otherwise, infer a coarse type bucket from title keywords as a fallback.

    • onEventClick

      public void onEventClick(@NonNull Event e)
      Open the details screen for the tapped event, passing its id as an extra.
      Specified by:
      onEventClick in interface BrowseEventsAdapter.Listener

    • onJoinClick

      public void onJoinClick(@NonNull Event e)
      Attempt to join the waitlist for the selected event. Implementation notes: - Uses the device ANDROID_ID as a lightweight unique user identifier (demo purpose). - Updates two array fields in Firestore (waitingList, allParticipants) atomically. - Shows a short Toast for success/failure feedback.
      Specified by:
      onJoinClick in interface BrowseEventsAdapter.Listener

    • toast

      private void toast(String msg)
      Safe Toast helper (no-op if the fragment is detached).
